title: Department of Defense support for "Jets in the Wild" episode of TV documentary series "Outside Beyond the Lens"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Defense support for "Jets in the Wild" episode of TV documentary series "Outside Beyond the Lens"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Defense (DoD) and the production of the episode "Jets in the Wild" of the TV documentary series "Outside Beyond the Lens" (2019-) Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; photographs; and all records of communications between employees of DoD and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Outside Beyond the Lens," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

"Outside Beyond the Lens" appears on a list of DoD entertainment industry collaborations released to me through FOIA. The list is attached to this request.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: FOIL Request – Arrest of Jodi Haddad (June 2024, Victory Chrysler, Rome, NY)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request – Arrest of Jodi Haddad (June 2024, Victory Chrysler, Rome, NY)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law (Public Officers Law §84 et seq.), I request unredacted digital copies of all video footage related to the arrest of Jodi Haddad, age 48, of Stockbridge, NY, who was arrested in June 2024 for allegedly stealing over $50,000 from Victory Chrysler in Rome, NY.

According to public reports, Haddad was charged with grand larceny and falsifying business records following a two-month investigation by the Oneida County Sheriff's Office. She was arraigned and released pending a future court date in Rome City Court.

Please include all body-worn camera, dashcam, interior patrol car, and interview room footage related to her arrest, transport, and processing.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daniele Mazzei

title: Public Comments in Response to Request for Information on Advancing Privacy-Enhancing Technologies

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Public Comments in Response to Request for Information on Advancing Privacy-Enhancing Technologies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- The metadata of all of the public comments received in response to the Science and Technology Policy Office's Request for Information on Advancing Privacy-Enhancing Technologies(Document Number: OSTP-2022-0011-0001).

- If possible, please include the public comments that have been submitted in response to this request for information.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I am requesting for a the purpose of conducting a research project by the Information School at the University of Washington. Additionally, this request is being made for the purpose of scholarly and scientific research.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nic Weber

In accordance with the RTKL, you are hereby notified that, for the reason set forth below, the Department is extending the final response date of your request to August 28, 2025.

At this time, the Department is unable to provide you with an estimated cost to fulfill your current request if it is granted.  Any actual or estimated fees will be identified in the Department's future response.

title: Rifle inventory records (Santa Clara County Sheriff)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Rifle inventory records (Santa Clara County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Records of the most recent inventory of rifles possessed by the Sheriff's Office, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code (assault rifles, patrol rifles, sniper rifles, .50 caliber rifles).
2. Records indicating the number of rifles, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code,  privately possessed by personnel of the Sheriff's Office with its authorization, OR the number of Sheriff's Office personnel with such authorization.

To assist with the prompt release of responsive material, I ask that you make records available to me as you locate them, rather than waiting until all responsive records have been collected and copied.
 
The requested documents or information from them will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

If you would like to discuss these requests, please feel free to reach out to me, John Lindsay-Poland, co-director of the American Friends Service Committee California Healing Justice Program at jlindsay-poland@afsc.org or by phone at 510-282-8983.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] California Public Records Act Request: Rifle inventory records (Santa Clara County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,


We received your public records request for “records of the most recent inventory of rifles possessed by the Sheriff's Office, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code (assault rifles, patrol rifles, sniper rifles, .50 caliber rifles) and  records indicating the number of rifles, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code, privately possessed by personnel of the Sheriff's Office with its authorization, OR the number of Sheriff's Office personnel with such authorization.”  The Sheriff’s Office is currently reviewing files for potentially responsive records and will assemble any records that are responsive to your request.  Under the provisions of Cal. Gov't Code § 7922.535, the Sheriff’s Office extends its 10-day deadline within which to respond by an additional 14 days. The new deadline for the Sheriff’s Office response is now Thursday, September 4, 2025.
Regards,


[Text  Description automatically generated]

Records Division
Office of the Sheriff, Santa Clara County
55 W. Younger Ave., San Jose, CA 95110

communications.communication:
Good Morning,

In response to your August 11 request for public records, Part 1: attached is the Sheriff’s Office Military Equipment Policy 706 that contains “the most recent inventory of rifles possessed by the Sheriff's Office.”
With respect to Part 2 of your request: the Sheriff’s Office does not maintain records of personally owned firearms that employees privately possess.

This closes your request for public records.

Regards,

communications.subject: RE: FOIA 6180 AGelzin Parks FOIA Log (Jan 2025)
communications.communication:
Dear Requestor,
We are still working on this request and therefore per section 140/3(e), the Park District is extending the time to respond to your request by five business days from the date presently due.  The reasons:
[ ] the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records;
[ ] the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records;
[ ] the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it;
[ ] the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them;
[x ] the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions;
[ ] the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by subsection (d) of this Section without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body;
[ ] there is a need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among 2 or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request.
If this is acceptable to you, please respond in writing to agree to this extension. The Park District is extending this request to Friday August 31, 2025 by close of business.
Sincerely,
Karen Choudhury

communications.subject: Nebraska Public Records Act Request: SOR and Community Supervision
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nebraska Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The exact number of people who are 

1) on both the sex offender registry and probation; and
2) on both the sex offender registry and parole;

as per the latest available data is requested.

If this cannot be provided, I request records that include:

The list of people on probation
The list of people on parole
The list of people on the sex offender registry

as per the latest available data. 

If this data is held by another agency, I request the name of that agency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wendy Sawyer

communications.subject: RE: Nebraska Public Records Act Request: SOR and Community Supervision
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

The Nebraska Department of Correctional Services (NDCS) has reviewed your request for public records.  Data on individuals currently on parole from NDCS is available on our website (corrections.nebraska.gov) through the Incarceration Records database.   A link to this database is located on homepage in the right-hand menu.  If you select "Download All" on the searchable database, a pop-up window will appear that will give you the opportunity to download spreadsheets of information from the database.  A direct link to that pop-up is https://dcs-inmatesearch.ne.gov/Corrections/COR_download.htm.  Selecting "Download Active" from this pop-up window will generate spreadsheets of data on individuals with active NDCS files.  This data can be filtered by institutional release type to only include individuals released onto parole.  The NDCS database does not maintain data on whether or not an individual is on the sex offender registry.  You may wish to obtain this data from another source and compare it to active NDCS parolees.  Probation for the State of Nebraska is under the jurisdiction of the Nebraska Supreme Court.  NDCS therefore does not maintain data on current probationers.  You may wish to reach out to the Nebraska Supreme Court to request such data.
Sincerely,
Kathleen Kokensparger
Public Records Manager | CENTRAL OFFICE

Nebraska Department of Correctional Services
OFFICE   402-479-5767
FAX       402-479-5623
kathleen.kokensparger@nebraska.gov<https://mail.nebraska.gov/owa/redir.aspx?C=V4pR88jIRUVzu0a_BEeYhUyMGoCTp3IRG0H1EFpsaE6smBMvij7WCA..&URL=mailto%3akathleen.kokensparger%40nebraska.gov>

title: Seeking records related to elected officials expense account, acct. #567700

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Seeking records related to elected officials expense account, acct. #567700
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please locate and produce to me an electronic copy of any documents and/or other records generated or received since January 1, 2023, that contain the phrase "elected official expense account." My understanding is that the documents I am hoping to review are related to a financial account numbered 567700, so it may be useful to include that number as a search term, either separately or in connection with the phrase "elected official expense account."

The records I am requesting are open public records within the definition of § 610.010(6). I am not aware of any provision of law that allows for the closure or withholding of these records. If a copy of these records is kept in an electronic format, I ask that you provide them to me in that electronic format. If either you or the public governmental body you represent contends that the documents I have requested – or any portion of those documents – are exempt from disclosure under Missouri’s Sunshine Law, I ask you to comply with § 610.024, RSMo., and make available to me for review any part of the records that you believe to be not exempt. Additionally, I hereby rely upon § 610.023.4, RSMo., and ask you to provide a written statement identifying any basis upon which you consider the records to be exempt from disclosure, including the specific provision(s) of law that you believe to justify denying my access to those documents.

This request must "be acted upon as soon as possible, but in no event later than the end of the third business day following the date the request is received." § 610.023.3, RSMo. If you do not agree to make the requested records available within three days of receiving this request, I demand a "detailed explanation of the cause for further delay.”

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Glenn Burleigh

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R001621-072325
communications.communication:
Dear Glenn  Burleigh: 
Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 7/24/2025 and given the reference number R001621-072325 for tracking purposes. 
 
You may review the details of your records request using the “My Records Center” link provided below. 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) based on the selections and details you provided in submitting your request. The Custodian(s) of Records for these department(s) will locate the records, if any, responsive to your request as well as determine any costs, pursuant to Chapter 610.026, RSMo., associated with fulfilling your request. 
PLEASE NOTE: The Sunshine Law  does not require a governmental body to create a new record, provide legal research, analysis, or conclusions, nor to answer questions or respond to information queries. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
Thank you for using the Sunshine Law/Public Records Center. 
 
City of St. Louis

communications.subject: RE: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request #R001621-072325
communications.communication:
It is my understanding that we should have received a response with records or information on availability within 72 hours of the city having received this request. It has now been longer than that. The public interest in this matter is important, so I am following up on the request. 

It is worth noting that the Sunshine Law allows courts to impose significant penalties against public governmental bodies and their members or employees when they commit knowing or purposeful violations of the law. Knowing violation of the Sunshine Law subjects the public government body or the individual member of that public body to a civil penalty in an amount up to $1,000, and the court is also authorized to require the defendant to pay the plaintiff’s attorney fees. Purposeful violation of the Sunshine Law is punishable by a civil penalty in an amount up to $5,000 and the court is compelled to require the defendant to pay the plaintiff’s attorney fees.

We look forward to your response.

title: Information Involving Arrest of "Luke J. Fournier" (7/30/2022)

communications.subject: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Information Involving Arrest of "Luke J. Fournier" (7/30/2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all police and arrest reports related to the traffic stop and subsequent arrest of "Luke J. Fournier" for OUI charges on or around July 30, 2022. The Charge Case Number is "22-38453".

Any mugshot photo related to the arrest of Luke J. Fournier in connection to this charge.

Audio of initial call made to police (if applicable).

All body-worn camera footage recorded by any Portland Police Department personnel during the initial stop, field sobriety testing, detention, arrest, and transport of Luke J. Fournier in connection to this charge.

All dash camera footage (including backseat view if applicable) from any patrol vehicles involved in the stop, detention, or transport of Luke J. Fournier in connection to this charge.

Please include footage captured shortly before, during, and immediately after the incident.

If portions of the requested footage are exempt or confidential, please produce the non-exempt portions and cite the specific legal exemptions justifying any withholding or redaction.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Scott Brass

communications.subject: RE: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Information Involving Arrest of "Luke J. Fournier" (7/30/2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all police and arrest reports related to the traffic stop and subsequent arrest of "Luke J. Fournier" for OUI charges on or around July 30, 2022. The Charge Case Number is "22-38453".

Any mugshot photo related to the arrest of Luke J. Fournier in connection to this charge.

Audio of initial call made to police (if applicable).

All body-worn camera footage recorded by any Portland Police Department personnel during the initial stop, field sobriety testing, detention, arrest, and transport of Luke J. Fournier in connection to this charge.

All dash camera footage (including backseat view if applicable) from any patrol vehicles involved in the stop, detention, or transport of Luke J. Fournier in connection to this charge.

Please include footage captured shortly before, during, and immediately after the incident.

If portions of the requested footage are exempt or confidential, please produce the non-exempt portions and cite the specific legal exemptions justifying any withholding or redaction.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Scott Brass

communications.subject: Re: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Information Involving Arrest of "Luke J. Fournier" (7/30/2022)
communications.communication:
This email is to acknowledge our receipt of your recent Maine Freedom of
Access request.

For fastest service, please visit our public records request portal.
<https://cityofportlandme.nextrequest.com/>

We are reviewing your request and working on gathering the information
requested. To the extent the documents you requested are protected and/or
confidential, we reserve the right to deny your request in whole or in
part. Once we have gathered the documents, we will make arrangements to get
you the non-protected and non-confidential information either digitally or
in hard copy. We will also include an invoice, if applicable, for the
reasonable costs of copying and up to $25 per hour, after the first two
hours, for the time involved in searching for, retrieving and compiling the
requested information as we are entitled to under 1 M.R.S.A. § 408-A.


-------------------------------
Jessica Grondin (she/her/hers)
Director of Communications & Digital Services
o: 207-756-8173
c: 617-435-3450

Sign up: city news & alerts <https://www.portlandmaine.gov/stayconnected>
Portland 311 <https://www.portlandmaine.gov/fixitportland>
www.portlandmaine.gov



-- 
Notice: Under Maine law, documents - including e-mails - in the possession 
of public officials or city employees about government business may be 
classified as public records. There are very few exceptions. As a result, 
please be advised that what is written in an e-mail could be released to 
the public and/or the media if requested.

communications.subject: RE: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Information Involving Arrest of "Luke J. Fournier" (7/30/2022)
communications.communication:
Good morning,

I wanted to follow up and check in on the current status of this records request. I was also wondering if there was an estimate available for any costs that may be incurred through the release of the footage related to this request.

Thank you for your work on this request

Sincerely,
Scott Brass

I've uploaded the report you requested in this matter.  Please note that certain personal identifying information has been redacted pursuant to 16 M.R.S. §804(3).  
With regard to your request for a mugshot, please note that the Portland Police Department does not take or maintain arrest photos.  For those records, you would need to contact the Cumberland County Sheriff's Office to request their records related to this arrest. 
There was no call to police in this matter, as you will note from the included report.  For future reference, audio of calls to public safety answering points is confidential and cannot be disclosed, pursuant to 25 M.R.S.A. §2929.  Transcripts can be prepared, with caller information redacted pursuant to that same statute, for a fee.  
With regard to your request for body camera and other video footage related to this incident, please note that our prior video system has overwritten that 2022 footage and we are therefore unable to provide it.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Records - Inmate Register Number: 10212-016
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All Bureau of Prisons records pertaining to former federal inmate Matthew Ianniello (1920 - 2012).

Ianniello's listed BOP Register Number is 10212-016.

Records should be made available without Privacy Act restriction, as Ianniello's death in 2012 has been widely reported:
* New York Times story reporting Ianniello's death: https://www.nytimes.com/2012/08/23/nyregion/mafia-boss-matty-the-horse-ianniello-dies-at-92.html
* Obituary from Newsday: https://www.legacy.com/obituaries/newsday/obituary.aspx?n=matthew-j-ianniello&pid=159290212

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

T. McElwee

communications.subject: Re: Freedom of Information Act Request: Records - Inmate Register Number: 10212-016
communications.communication:
T. McElwee,
I am unable to access the links you provided. Will you please save those pages in PDF format (or similar) and forward to this email address. 
Please be advised, no further action will be taken until your request is received with proof of death.
Respectfully,
S. Arellano
Government Information Specialist
Department of Justice
Office of the General Counsel

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Records - Inmate Register Number: 10212-016
communications.communication:
This is in reply to Government Information Specialist S. Arellano's response to my request for records concerning Matthew Ianniello's BOP records.

S. Arellano stated asked, "Will you please save those pages in PDF format (or similar) and forward to this email address."

PDF versions of the articles cited as proof of death are attached to this message. Please note, original publication dates are from August 2012.

Thank you, 

TM
A no responsive documents response.

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: 25-151
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All emails, text messages, chat messages (Teams, Slack, etc), and/or call logs regarding the fulfillment of PDR 25-151, including accompanying metadata. For any responsive chat and text messages, please provide messages sent/received in that thread within 1 hour of the responsive message as context.
2. Any notes, work logs, or other memoranda produced in the fulfillment of PDR 25-151.
3. All Lakewood Police contracts, Memorandums of Understanding (MOUs), Memorandums of Agreement (MOAs), and Non-Disclosure Agreements (NDAs)  with Flock Safety.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Your City of Lakewood public records request #25-514 has been closed.
communications.communication:
City of Lakewood ************************************************************************ Record request #25-514 has been closed. The closure reason supplied was: Thank you for your public records request. The fourth and final installment has been released for your review. We are closing the request by having released portions of all responsive records which are not exempt from disclosure by RCW 42.56 and/or other statutes, as detailed in the exemption log(s). According to the City of Lakewood's Information Technology department, metadata is accessible on the requester's end from the records the City has provided. I am not an IT expert, but I did search how to access metadata, to access the metadata per electronic file, you can select - file ----> properties -----> internet header. This request is now considered closed. The PRA’s one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review has started to run because the agency does not intend to further address the request. While we consider this request to be concluded, the requester may ask follow-up questions within a reasonable time frame by contacting us via email at PRR@cityoflakewood.us or by phone at 253-983-7801 during business hours, Monday through Friday from 8:30 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of Lakewood.

Technical support: See our help page

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Leftist Bulletins
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Bulletins and alerts generated, sent, or received mentioning any of the following political parties/organizations:
- Democratic Socialists of America
- Socialist Alternative
- Party for Socialism and Liberation
- Spartacist League
- International Marxist Tendency
- Revolutionary Communist International
- Revolutionary Communist Party
- African People's Socialist Party
- Uhuru Movement
- Black Hammer
- Communist Party USA
- American Communist Party
- Freedom Road Socialist Organization
- Workers World Party
- Socialist Action

You may limit the search to the dates between 13 July 2014 and 16 September 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

Your request was received in this office on 9/16/2024 and given the reference number R013592-091624 for tracking purposes.

- Revolutionary Communist International

- Workers World Party
- Socialist Action

You may limit the search to the dates between 13 July 2014 and 16 September 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffusion-center-6083%252Fleftist-bulletins-173349%252F%253Femail%253Dwafusion%252540wsp.wa.gov&url_auth_token=AAAWdYSK76SGUzJuvxL8ZY4HNaI%3A1sqNZW%3ARTcwp6Y55p9jxIXvFfp8Ov0oJEqQ5EZBL0QcRAB69Kk

You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The Washington Public Records Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 

You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
Washington State Patrol

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Rifle inventory records (Tuolumne County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Records of the most recent inventory of rifles possessed by the Sheriff's Office, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code (assault rifles, patrol rifles, sniper rifles, .50 caliber rifles).
2. Records indicating the number of rifles, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code,  privately possessed by personnel of the Sheriff's Office with its authorization, OR the number of Sheriff's Office personnel with such authorization.

To assist with the prompt release of responsive material, I ask that you make records available to me as you locate them, rather than waiting until all responsive records have been collected and copied.
 
The requested documents or information from them will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

If you would like to discuss these requests, please feel free to reach out to me, John Lindsay-Poland, co-director of the American Friends Service Committee California Healing Justice Program at jlindsay-poland@afsc.org or by phone at 510-282-8983.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Rifle inventory records (Tuolumne County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
Good morning, in response to your request below, our client responds as follows:

Sixty (60) Colt AR-15 Patrol Rifles
Twenty-four (24) Aero Precision AR-15 Rifles, SWAT

Our two (2) precision rifles don't fall under the "Assault Rifle" category, as they are both bolt action rifles.
Our shotguns also don't fall into this category because they are pump-action.

With regard to personnel authorization to possess weapons in the categories you identified, our sworn patrol deputies are authorized by policy to possess the type of firearms you identified.  You may review our sheriff's policies at: 2024-9-Tuolumne-County-SO-Policy-Manual<https://www.tuolumnecounty.ca.gov/DocumentCenter/View/28109/2024-9-Tuolumne-County-SO-Policy-Manual>    If I am misunderstanding this part of your request, please contact me.

Best regards,
Christopher J. Schmidt

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Rifle inventory records (Tuolumne County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Schmidt,

Thank you for your response regarding my PRA request for records of ownership of assault rifles by the TCSO or its staff. I appreciate it.

Regarding my request related to rifles owned by staff, my request is for records indicating the number of assault rifles personally owned by staff (not for a record of the policy authorizing such ownership). For example, the policy manual states in Section 312.3.4(d) that "Members shall provide written notice of the make, model, color, serial number and caliber of the firearm to the Rangemaster, who will maintain a list of the information." (see below) Therefore, I am requesting copies of such records, including those kept by the Rangemaster, in order to identify the number of such personally owned rifles. 

Thanks for your work on this.

best,
John Lindsay-Poland


312.3.4 PERSONALLY OWNED DUTY FIREARMS
Members desiring to carry an authorized but personally owned duty firearm must receive written
approval from the Sheriff or the authorized designee. Once approved, personally owned duty
firearms are subject to the following restrictions:
(a) The firearm shall be in good working order and on the office list of approved firearms.
(b) The firearm shall be inspected by the Rangemaster prior to being carried and
thereafter shall be subject to inspection whenever it is deemed necessary.
(c) Prior to carrying the firearm, members shall qualify under range supervision and
thereafter shall qualify in accordance with the office qualification schedule. Members
must demonstrate proficiency and safe handling, and that the firearm functions
properly.
(d) Members shall provide written notice of the make, model, color, serial number and
caliber of the firearm to the Rangemaster, who will maintain a list of the information.

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

In August 2024 I submitted a records request for all documents related to the James Scandirito case (Request Number: 2024-5808). I was quoted a rough estimate of $400 for the digital evidence on 6/25/2024, but at the time I declined to move forward with the digital evidence portion and the request was closed. I would now like to move forward with digital evidence and I'm writing to request an invoice. Also, would it be possible for me to get an index or list of contents for the digital evidence portion, so I would know in advance what it will contain? Is there any other material in this case? Would the State's Attorney's office be able to help me with further discovery documents?
Many thanks for your help,

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Mikita Brottman

communications.subject: Boca Raton PD JustFOIA#2025-9180
communications.communication:
Good morning,
This email is in response to your public records request received by the City on 8/18, "...I would now like to move forward with digital evidence and I'm writing to request an invoice. Also, would it be possible for me to get an index or list of contents for the digital evidence portion, so I would know in advance what it will contain? Is there any other material in this case?..."

An initial estimate of the costs and special service charges (for extensive use of information technology resources and extensive clerical and supervisory assistance) for the time required to search for, identify, compile, and potentially redact the responsive records is as follows:
*       Evidence Personnel, 1 hours at $38.50 per hour;
*       Initial review: 1 audio, 1,839 photos, 10 videos totaling over 4 hours of footage (see invoice for notes);

The total estimated special service charge in connection with your request is $77.00.  An invoice is attached regarding the total invoice amount.
Upon receipt of the estimated charges, payable through the JustFOIA portal, the City will continue to process your records request. These estimated charges will be adjusted based upon the actual time spent in identifying, compiling, and potentially redacting the requested records. If the actual costs are determined to be less than the estimated costs, the difference will be refunded to you. If the actual costs are higher than the estimated costs, we will contact you and provide the additional cost information.
To pay online with a credit card, click here https://bocaratonfl.justfoia.com/publicportal (your Security Key # 0AD3AE3A, Request # 2025-9180 will be required). You will be redirected to a separate site to submit credit card information and will receive your receipt for payment via email.
In compliance with the Public Records Act, the City has used good faith and reasonable efforts to review and assess your request and develop the estimates provided herein. If you believe that we have misunderstood the scope and/ or nature of your request, please contact us to provide clarification so that we may correctly estimate the service charges and costs in connection with a modified search.


[X]
Raven Doyle  |  Multimedia Evidence Custodian
City of Boca Raton, Field Services Division
100 NW 2nd Ave, Boca Raton, FL 33432
P  561-338-1341  |  rdoyle@bocaraton-fl.gov<mailto:rdoyle@bocaraton-fl.gov>

Stay connected with us on social media!<http://www.myboca.us/stayconnected>


Please note: Florida has a very broad public records law. Most written communications to or from local officials regarding city business are public records, and are available to the public and media upon request. Your e-mail communications may therefore be subject to public disclosure.

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the records listed below regarding the following four software programs: 

• Thompson Reuters Clear (https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/clear)
• LexisNexis Accurint (https://www.accurint.com/)
• TransUnion TLOxp, which may also be part of the TruLookup system (https://www.tlo.com/law-enforcement)
• SoundThinking CrimeTracer, which was formerly a product called COPLINK X (https://www.soundthinking.com/law-enforcement/crime-analysis-crimetracer/) from the company formerly known as ShotSpotter

For each of the above mentioned platforms, please provide the following records: 

• CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS —  All contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits) and agreements related to the acquisition and use of these "software" programs.
• PURCHASE INFORMATION — All invoices and purchase information for costs and products associated with the above-referenced platforms.

Please provide responsive materials for the period from January 1, 2021 through the date this request is processed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Caesar Andrews

communications.subject: Government Records Access and Management Act Request: Library Contract Request: Sage Journals
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Government Records Access and Management Act, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with Sage relating to the licensing of Sage Journals;
All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and
All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the contractual relations with Sage for journal licensing. 

Please do not limit your search to strictly direct agreements or renewals between the institution and the vendor (Sage), but include all agreements and related documentation through consortia such as the Utah Academic Library Consortium (UALC) or Lyrasis.

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of Sage Journals.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ellen Dubinsky

communications.subject: RE: Government Records Access and Management Act Request: Library Contract Request: Sage Journals
communications.communication:
Dear Ellen Dubinsky,

Salt Lake Community College (“SLCC”) received your August 20, 2025, GRAMA request for the most recent contract with Sage related to the licensing of Sage Journals. Please find attached the records responsive to your request.

You also requested that SLCC include agreements SLCC entered through a consortium, such as Utah Academic Library Consortium (UALC). SLCC does not negotiate, sign, or maintain UALC agreements, MOUs, etc. You will need to contact UALC directly (ualc-mail@lists.utah.edu<mailto:ualc-mail@lists.utah.edu>) for those records. SLCC libraries are not members of Lyrasis.


Sincerely,
Ann Richins
Appointed Records Officer
Risk Management

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Agreements related to the beverage pouring, distribution, sales or marketing rights for campus, athletics venues or facilities.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Kelly North

communications.subject: Acknowledgement RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Our office is in receipt of your public records request.

Our office will determine the existence and/or availability of the records that you seek and provide an appropriate response.  The Ohio Public Records Act requires that a public office respond to a public records request within a “reasonable amount of time.”  This time requirement must be judged within the context of the circumstances in each individual case. State ex rel. Wadd v. City of Cincinnati, 81 Ohio St. 3d 50, 53, 689 N.E.2d 25 (1998).  Further, this standard incorporates an opportunity for legal review. State ex rel. Taxpayers Coalition v. City Lakewood, 86 Ohio St. 3d 385, 715 N.E.2d 179 (1999).

I will notify you if there will be any charges associated with photocopying (if applicable).

If you have any questions, please contact our office.

Most sincerely,
Sandy

Sandy L. Dellicarpini
Senior LA - PA w Public Records
Office of General Counsel w University of Cincinnati
Campus. 368 University Hall
Phone. (513) 558-3485
Direct Line :  (513) 558-1726
Email: gardnesd@ucmail.uc.edu<mailto:gardnesd@ucmail.uc.edu>

CONFIDENTIAL COMMUNICATION: The foregoing message and/or attachments hereto may contain or constitute confidential attorney-client communications.  You should not copy, forward or otherwise distribute this message to others without the permission of the sender.  If you believe that you are not the intended recipient of this message, you should delete this message without retaining a copy and inform the sender of your action.  Your cooperation will be appreciated.

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
Good morning,

In fulfillment of your request of August 21 for “Agreements related to the beverage pouring, distribution, sales or marketing rights for campus, athletics venues or facilities.”, the responsive record it attached.
In compliance with Ohio Records Law, R.C. 149.43, sections deemed proprietary (e.g., commission payments, etc.)  by the vendor, were redacted as trade secret information.

The University’s response concludes your request.

If you are unable to access the enclosed pages, please let me know.

Thank you.
Sandy

title: Ed Martin Wikipedia, "Requests for Information" Letters (Second Request)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Ed Martin Wikipedia, "Requests for Information" Letters (Second Request)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any letter sent by Interim United States Attorney Ed Martin containing the words "I receive requests". 

2. Any communications sent to or from United States Attorney Ed Martin which mention "Wikimedia", "Wikipedia", "Wiki", or *wiki* (i.e., using asterisks as wildcards such that a search would return, e.g., https://wikipedia.org/). 

This request is limited to letters or communications sent to or received by Martin on or after January 20, 2025.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

REQUEST FOR EXPEDITED PROCESSING:

I request that this request be expedited under 28 CFR § 16.5(e)(1)(ii) and (iv) for the following reasons:

1. I certify the following to be true and correct: My organization is primarily engaged in disseminating information. The Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression (FIRE) maintains a news website at https://thefire.org/news, through which its staff members regularly publish news stories and editorial content concerning the activities of governments, government officials, and other persons or organizations of public concern. I am a staff member of FIRE. I frequently write about matters involving the First Amendment and academic freedom, including on FIRE's website. See, e.g., https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303. A substantial component of my duties as a staff member of FIRE is to obtain information through public records requests, including through the Freedom of Information Act, which I or my colleagues then share through FIRE's website and social media channels. I also publish news and other information of public concern via "X" (https://x.com/adamsteinbaugh) and "Bluesky" (https://bsky.app/profile/adamsteinbaugh.bsky.social).

The Department has previously granted FIRE expedited processing in a related request. See Request No. EOUSA-2025-003687 (Apr. 24, 2025).

2. The requested information concerns an actual or alleged government activity, namely an Interim United States Attorney's practice of sending letters seeking "information" for speech protected by the First Amendment. Specifically, Ed Martin has sent letters to (a) Georgetown University Law Center concerning its faculty members' classroom teaching (https://www.ncronline.org/files/2025-03/3.7.24%20Ed%20Martin%20letter%20%20to%20Georgetown%20law.pdf); (b) U.S. Sen. Charles E. Schumer concerning U.S. Supreme Court Justices Brett Kavanaugh and Neil M. Gorsuch (https://www.washingtonpost.com/dc-md-va/2025/02/19/ed-martin-dc-letters-schumer-garcia/); (c) U.S. Rep. Robert Garcia concerning comments made about Elon Musk (https://bsky.app/profile/robertgarcia.bsky.social/post/3lin33orhnk2r); and (d) a medical journal's editor (https://x.com/_Eric_Reinhart/status/1912958244768690407).  This request cocnerns an additional letter Martin sent to Wikimedia Foundation, Inc. (https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ocNyx34Et19sKtlta0bTPPzSPcpi375T/view).

3. The requested information extends beyond the public's right to know about government activity generally and instead has a particular value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis. The information pertains to a news story of public interest. That issue has attracted a wide range of news media coverage, including the numerous articles identified below, which are helpful in establishing that there is an urgency to inform the public on this topic.

Examples of recent articles demonstrating the public's ongoing and current interest in this information include articles:

a. https://www.thefp.com/p/trump-prosecutor-threatens-wikipedia
b. https://www.washingtonpost.com/dc-md-va/2025/03/05/dc-us-attorney-ed-martin-georgetown-law-dei/
c. https://thepostmillennial.com/us-atty-ed-martin-demands-georgetown-law-school-answer-for-dei-in-curriculum-hiring-and-programs
d. https://www.nytimes.com/2025/03/06/us/politics/ed-martin-us-attorney-washington-trump.html
e. https://thehill.com/homenews/education/5181345-georgetown-law-school-dei-trump/
f. https://www.msnbc.com/rachel-maddow-show/maddowblog/trump-appointed-prosecutor-gets-much-needed-refresher-first-amendment-rcna195321
g. https://www.rawstory.com/ed-martin-georgetown-clash/
h. https://reason.com/volokh/2025/03/07/may-government-refuse-to-hire-notre-dame-students-because-notre-dame-teaches-and-promotes-anti-abortion-ideology
i. https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/mar/06/ed-martin-us-attorney-dei
j. https://www.newsmax.com/politics/georgetown-dei-william-treanor/2025/03/06/id/1201790/
k. https://www.wusa9.com/article/news/politics/federal-fallout/georgetown-law-school-wont-bow-to-dei-threat-from-dcs-acting-federal-prosecutor-ed-martin-donald-trump-william-treanor/65-22ac5a1d-43a8-492b-92db-1f8c6f70f76c
l. https://www.usatoday.com/story/opinion/columnist/2025/03/07/dei-georgetown-us-attorney-first-amendment/81793644007/
m. https://www.washingtonian.com/2025/03/07/william-treanor-georgetown-law-ed-martin-first-amendment/
n. https://abovethelaw.com/2025/03/georgetown-law-to-ed-martin-f-all-the-way-off/
o. https://www.thecollegefix.com/top-d-c-federal-prosecutor-says-he-doesnt-want-law-students-from-georgetown-because-of-dei/
p. https://slate.com/news-and-politics/2025/03/georgetown-william-treanor-ed-martin-trump-doj-dei.html
q. https://www.washingtonpost.com/dc-md-va/2025/02/19/ed-martin-dc-letters-schumer-garcia/
r. https://www.nytimes.com/2025/03/03/us/politics/us-attorney-justice-dept-schumer-inquiry.html
s.  https://www.mediaite.com/politics/maga-u-s-attorney-sends-letter-to-house-democrat-over-criticism-of-elon-musk-who-you-call-a-dick/
t. https://www.rawstory.com/trump-justice-department-2671190340/
u. https://www.yahoo.com/news/acting-dc-us-attorney-ed-150929791.html
v. https://www.techdirt.com/2025/02/21/trumps-dc-us-attorney-launches-project-whirlwind-to-investigate-critics-for-their-speech/

4. This information is relevant to a matter of widespread and exceptional media interest in which there exist possible questions about the government's integrity that affect public confidence. There is widespread and exceptional media interest in this matter, as reflected in the above articles originating from outlets across the ideological spectrum, including the article published by The Free Press concerning Martin's letter to Wikimedia (https://www.thefp.com/p/trump-prosecutor-threatens-wikipedia). This matter raises "possible questions" about government integrity affecting public confidence because the alleged conduct involves a United States Attorney's pressure on educational institutions, academic publications, and elected officials to limit protected speech on matters on public concern. A prominent First Amendment scholar has raised questions about the propriety of Attorney Martin's "inquiry" into Georgetown University Law Center due to its curriculum. Eugene Volokh, "May Government Refuse to Hire Notre Dame Students, Because Notre Dame Teaches and Promotes Anti-Abortion Ideology?" (Volokh Conspiracy, March 7, 2025), https://reason.com/volokh/2025/03/07/may-government-refuse-to-hire-notre-dame-students-because-notre-dame-teaches-and-promotes-anti-abortion-ideology. Further, Attorney Martin's letter to Wikimedia was sent as members of the United States Senate requested disciplinary action against Attorney Martin due to his similar efforts to suppress speech protected by the First Amendment. See https://www.nytimes.com/2025/03/06/us/politics/ed-martin-us-attorney-washington-trump.html.

Mr. Martin's letters are of particular interest because they are relevant to his nomination for the office of U.S. Attorney for the District of Columbia. On April 2, 2025, ten members of the United States Senate sent a letter to Sen. Chuck Grassley, Chairman of the U.S. Senate Judiciary Committee, asking him to schedule a hearing to consider Martin’s nomination. (Letter from Sen. Richard J. Durbin, et al., to Sen. Chuck Grassley, Apr. 2, 2025, available at https://s3.documentcloud.org/documents/25878847/ed-martin-hearing-letter-4225-final.pdf.)  At least one prominent commentator has cited Martin’s efforts to chill curriculum at Georgetown (among other efforts to chill speech) as a reason for the Senate to refuse to confirm Martin. (Jack Goldsmith, The Senate and the Edward Martin Nomination, Executive Function (Apr. 3, 2025), https://executivefunctions.substack.com/p/the-senate-and-the-edward-martin.) These concerns, raised by prominent intellectual and political leaders, indicate that Martin's letters raise possible questions about the government's integrity.

REQUEST FOR A FEE WAIVER OR REDUCED FEES:

I request, under 28 CFR § 16.10(k), a waiver or reduction of fees for the following reasons:

1. Disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because its disclosure would shed light on the operations or activities of the government. The requested information pertains specifically to controversial conduct by an Interim United States Attorney.

2. Disclosure of the requested information would be likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of those operations or activities. Disclosure of the requested information would meaningfully inform the public about the Department's activities and operations.

3. Disclosure of the requested information will contribute to the understanding of a reasonably broad audience of persons interested in the subject, as opposed to the individual understanding of the requester. The requestor is a licensed attorney who practices First Amendment law. As such, the requestor will be able to effectively convey information to the public. Further, the requestor is a representative of the news media. The requestor and his employer, the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, gather information of potential interest to a segment of the public, turns that information into distinct works (including through its news website, located at https://thefire.org/news), and distributes that information to the public. The information requested here relates to information that is about current events or that would be of current interest to the public. The requestor's past publication record (in addition to FIRE's articles available at https://thefire.org/news) is available at https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303.

4. The requested information is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. The requestor works for a nonprofit organization and the records are not sought for a commercial purpose.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Rifle inventory records (Mendocino County Sheriff's Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Rifle inventory records (Mendocino County Sheriff's Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Records of the most recent inventory of rifles possessed by the Sheriff's Office, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code (assault rifles, patrol rifles, sniper rifles, .50 caliber rifles).
2. Records indicating the number of rifles, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code,  privately possessed by personnel of the Sheriff's Office with its authorization, OR the number of Sheriff's Office personnel with such authorization.

To assist with the prompt release of responsive material, I ask that you make records available to me as you locate them, rather than waiting until all responsive records have been collected and copied.
 
The requested documents or information from them will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

If you would like to discuss these requests, please feel free to reach out to me, John Lindsay-Poland, co-director of the American Friends Service Committee California Healing Justice Program at jlindsay-poland@afsc.org or by phone at 510-282-8983.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

Jimmy Tobias

title: Bag Search Policy and Face Mask Prohibition during July 4, 2025 Food Truck Festival (City Clerk)

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Untitled (City Clerk)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Information related to the July 4, 2025 Food Truck Festival held in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania on Front Street.
- The audio recording and script of any public announcements played during the event, indicating that "bags are subject to search."
- Documentation showing the location and timing of these announcements (e.g., speaker placement, frequency).
- Any communication concerning the development, authorization, and legal justification for the stated bag search policy and prohibition of ski masks or other face coverings during the event.
- Instructions provided to personnel to conduct or justify searches based on suspicion, behavior, or appearance
- Whether and how Community Service Aides (CSAs) were authorized to participate in or conduct searches
- Any official directives, standard operating procedures, briefings, or training documents provided to personnel outlying authority to conduct searches or enforce face covering policies
- Any public facing materials issued before the event, including press releases, city website updates, social media posts, event signage plans and verbiage, informing the public about bag searches, face covering rules, or related enforcement policies
- Any incident repots, enforcement logs, or field notes documenting actual searches or encounters with individuals during the event, include those stopped for wearing face coverings, bags being search, or appearing "suspicious"

Communication includes any internal or external communication (including email, text messages, memos, meeting notes, call logs, city council meeting notes) within and between the following related to the bag search policy and face covering restriction:
- The City of Harrisburg (including the Mayor’s Office, City Council, and all municipal departments)
- The Harrisburg Bureau of Police
- The Pennsylvania State Police (PSP)
- The Dauphin County District Attorney’s Office
- Any Dauphin County government offices
- Any Pennsylvania state government departments or officials
- Any Federal government agencies, law enforcement, or intelligence agency

Provide the requested records electronically if available.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sebastian Sibrand

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Selwyn Raab
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Selwyn Raab (June 26, 1934 - March 4, 2025). Proof of death is not required as his death was widely reported: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/03/04/business/media/selwyn-raab-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

Files 65-HQ-33586 and 65-HQ-36582 on the interception of diplomatic communications from the Japanese government during and after World War II.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

title: Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 FOIA Logs (Department of Justice - FOIA/PA Mail Referral Unit)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 FOIA Logs (Department of Justice - FOIA/PA Mail Referral Unit)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the log of all Freedom of Information Act request made between 2010 and 2018 that includes the term "Title IX" within reference to the Education Amendments of 1972, specifically as they refer to sexual misconduct policy. I ask that all fields — including the subject of the request, the nature and description of the request, the requester, the status of the request, the dates on which it was requested and the date of its most recent status, the tracking number assigned to the request, and the final disposition of the request — be included.

I require this data for academic research purposes, in association with the University of Maryland - College Park. The study aims to understand the recent history of the development of Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, from 2010 to now.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sarah Silberman

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request an electronic, parcel-level extract containing current Group E (Educational) and Group A (Assembly) occupancies and associated fire-sprinkler information for all parcels within the jurisdiction: 

Please provide one CSV with the following columns (your native field names are fine):
- Parcel identifier (APN / PIN / BBL)
• Site address (street #, street, city, ZIP)
• Latitude & longitude
• Internal building / permit ID
• Year built
• Floor area (sq ft)
• Number of stories
• Current IBC occupancy code (E, A-1…A-5)
• Occupancy description
• Fire-sprinkler present (Yes / No / Unknown)
• Date of last fire-sprinkler inspection (if tracked)
• Owner name & mailing address (if stored)

If any field is not maintained, please note that rather than withholding the entire record.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Cavise
